Entries.default:
As you step away from the blood-scented chaos of the arena and into the darkened antechamber, you sense a lurking presence.

It is not unlike stepping through a cobweb.
"It seems no weakness escapes your attention. No advantage goes unclaimed."
"But you are touched by the Changeling, with nature's glory writ across your brow."
"We are not unimpressed."
"You again? What do you want?"
"You said 'we' - who else do you mean?"
"This place is great. Killing strangers usually makes me a criminal. But here, I'm a hero."
"Have I spilled enough blood for you yet?"
[Say nothing.]
"Rouse them, and they will open the way to us."
"This place was my life's work. But never was I alone."
"Some possess only a shallow understanding of these stones. Of this soil. I hope you are not one of them."
"It is the Crucible you must appease - my appetite for violence, whatever its depth, is irrelevant."
"If it's so important that I'm victorious, why would the Crucible allow for me to lose?"
"Considering I'm on an island built by cutthroat competition, it seems safe to assume you're using me."
"What if someone else bests me? What will become of this place?"
"I bet you give this little speech to all the contenders."
"The Crucible is not in accord with itself. It knows neither what it wants nor what it needs."
A small smile splits the soul's features.
"You remind me of another I knew once. Long ago."
"Then this year's champion will revel in victory and do nothing to counsel the spirits within the Crucible."
"I openly lure you from one danger to the next."
"My hopes rest upon you. It is in my interest - and that of Kazuwari - that you succeed."
"I've heard enough."
"The contenders fall away in screams and lamentation. A champion will soon emerge."
The woman's visage thins into nothing.
"I met someone like you in the valley of the boars."
"I encountered another of your kind after dealing with the stelgaer in the lowveld."
"The Surviving Face. An individual only bested by time."
"The Slaying Face. The very image of Toamowhai's rage - a life-long disciple of carnage."
"So long as the Crucible exists, I suspect they will be here, stubborn, yes, but constant."
"Beware his fury."

"Again and again, you stand victorious in this sacred place."

The shimmering form of the woman you saw in the forest coalesces from the shadows.
"We should expect no less."
"We desire only your success. When you've fed of conflict and suckled on blood, the souls shall sing as one."
"Anyone could rouse the souls here, but only a Watcher can reach us through them."
"And we will pray to Galawain that this place does not fall into ruins before a Watcher of sufficient strength comes to do what you could not."
"Just who are you?"
"The other Face used to be a living being?"
She nods.
"As was I."
"The architect. The spinner of this web. The one who sought endlessly and then beyond."
"We are all many things to many people."
"But life is not equivalent to existence. You know this well, do you not?"
"To you, I am the Seeking Face. And a guide, if you'll accept it."
"Certainly the Crucible means more to me than your safety and well-being, but for now, they are one and the same."
"Ready yourself. The Lord of the Hunt abhors the ill-prepared."
"Another chat with the Faces?"
"Yes."
"The Seeking Face, specifically."
"Let's get a move on."
"Sure, sure. Sorry to bother. Don't mind me. Just bored to death over here."
"Strange. I didn't see or hear anything."
"Perhaps you're more attuned to them now?"
"Or maybe it's because you're among the stones of the Crucible."
"Regardless, you seem to be on the right track. Keep at it."
"The Slaying Face, specifically."
"The Surviving Face, specifically."
